Package io.tweetninja.cli.Types

Class Task

  • java.lang.Object
    • io.tweetninja.cli.Types.Task
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Runnable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    SimpleTask
    public abstract class Task
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Runnable
    Called by the task manager and runs asynchronously. Blocking operations like readLine are cordially forbidden within subclasses.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class Description
      static class  Task.TaskStatus
      Enumerates the different types of statuses that can exist.

    • Method Detail

      • instantiate

        public static <T extends Task> T instantiate​(java.lang.Class<T> c)
        Helper function to create an instance of a subclass, such as a class pulled from the registry.
        Parameters:
        c - The class of which to make an instance of.
        Returns:
        An instance of that class, or null if this failed.

      • setStatus

        protected final void setStatus​(java.lang.String s,
                               Task.TaskStatus t)
        Sets the status of this task. Should usually only be called by the task itself.
        Parameters:
        s - The message to accompany the status.
        t - The type of status that this is.

      • onStatusChange

        public final void onStatusChange​(java.lang.Runnable cb)
        Fires a callback whenever the status of this task changes.
        Parameters:
        cb - The callback to fire.

      • getStatusMessage

        public final java.lang.String getStatusMessage()
        Gets the current status message of the task.
        Returns:
        Aforementioned status message.

      • getStatusType

        public final Task.TaskStatus getStatusType()
        Gets the current status type of the task.
        Returns:
        Aforementioned status type.

      • setProgress

        protected final void setProgress​(float progress)
        Sets the progress of this task as a float from 0-1.
        Parameters:
        progress - Progress, 0 meaning none and 1 meaning done.

      • getProgress

        public final float getProgress()
        Gets the progress of this task as a float from 0-1.
        Returns:
        Progress, 0 meaning none and 1 meaning done.

      • stop

        public final void stop()
        Force stop (thread interrupt) this task.

      • run

        public final void run()
        Runs the task. Should always be used over #start, as #start has no security check.
        Specified by:
        run in interface java.lang.Runnable

      • start

        protected void start()
        What to run while the task is running. This can be halted at any minute. By default, this is empty, so the method should be overwritten.

      • setup

        protected void setup()
        Ran by the task manager before the task can be started. This should be used to gather any necessary parameters the task will need, but the method is empty by default. Please overwrite it in subclasses.
